alert.note: Alert for Catahoula (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 11:06AM CDT until May 11 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN TENSAS...NORTH CENTRAL CATAHOULA AND FRANKLIN PARISHES... At 1105 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Enterprise, or 13 miles north of Harrisonburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Wisner and Jigger around 1120 AM CDT. Winnsboro and Gilbert around 1130 AM CDT. Crowville around 1150 AM CDT. Newlight around 1155 AM CDT. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
